
Conversion of CCGBank Dependencies to the SDP 2015 Format

Version 1.0; September 28, 2015


Overview
========

This subdirectory contains a conversion of the word–word dependencies in
CCGbank [1] to bilexical dependency graphs in the data format used in the
SemEval 2015 Task on Broad-Coverage Semantic Dependency Parsing, henceforth
SDP.  The format is described on the following web page:

  http://sdp.delph-in.net/2015/data.html

In the remainder of this document, we refer to the converted dependency graphs
as CCG dependency graphs or CCD graphs.

[1] Julia Hockenmaier and Mark Steedman. CCGbank. A Corpus of CCG Derivations
and Dependency Structures Extracted from the Penn Treebank. *Computational
Linguistics*, 33:355–396, 2007.


How the Dependency Graphs are Constructed
=========================================

The arcs of the CCD graphs are read off the predicate–argument structure files
released with CCGbank.  A dependency from word h (head) to word d (dependent)
in which d fills the k-th argument slot of the lexical category of h is
represented by an arc from h to d labeled with k.  This information is used to
fill field 6 (PRED) and the fields starting from 8 of each token in the data.

The remaining fields of each token are filled using information extracted from
the syntactic derivations released with CCGbank.

  Field 1 (ID): position of the token in the sentence
  Field 2 (FORM): word form
  Field 3 (LEMMA): left empty
  Field 4 (POS): modified part-of-speech tag
  Field 5 (TOP): see below
  Field 7 (FRAME): lexical category associated with the token

Each CCD graph has a unique TOP node; this is the node that correponds to the
unique token that projects the final category of the underlying derivation.
The position of this token is computed based on the derivation tree by starting
at the root node and at each inner node proceeding to the head daughter.

The conversion from CCGbank to SDP format was implemented using the script
ccg2sdp.py, which is included in this directory.  Usage:

  ccg2sdp.py 2005T13/data > ccg.sdp

For maximum compatibility with the original SDP 2015 data, the resulting graphs
were further aligned at the token level, normalizing some punctuation marks to
modern, Unicode glyphs (using ‘“’, ‘”’, ‘‘’, ‘’’, and ‘—’; instead of the
LaTeX-style coding in the original PTB files), unescaping slashes (‘/’ instead
of ‘\/’), and re-inserting quotation marks that (apparently) were eliminated in
the construction of CCGbank.

======================================

the original SDP data.  There are 35,584 sentences (or 801,149 tokens) in the
training data, and 1,407 sentences (31,837 tokens) in the test segment.

Data Split
==========

The data is split into two parts, for training (Sections 00 to 20) and testing
(Section 21), as was done in the original SDP tasks.  The recommendation of the
SDP organizers for an additional development split, if need by, is to separate
Section 20 from the training data.


Release History
===============

+ Initial release of data and associated conversion code from CCGbank.
